subject: Re: JUnit Anti-patterns
msgSnippet: ... Thanks for that Tom. I think that those links and explaination would be really beneficial for the anti-patterns. I ll add them in RSN. Cheers, Joe P.S. I
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Tom Copeland" <tom@...> wrote:
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> > Behalf Of Joe Schmetzer
> > Sent: Friday, February 17, 2006 7:25 PM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [junit] JUnit Anti-patterns
> >
> >
> > I've just updated the JUnit Anti-patterns page I maintain at
> > http://www.exubero.com/junit/antipatterns.html. I'd be
> > interested in any feedback, if people want to suggest
> > additions or improvements.
>
> Hi Joe -
>
> Might be worth adding a link to the PMD JUnit checks:
>
> http://pmd.sourceforge.net/rules/junit.html
>
> UnnecessaryBooleanAssertion, for example, checks for the
> assertTrue(true) case that you mention in the "Redundant Assertions"
> section.
>
> Also, you could perhaps link to the "PMD Applied" supplemental chapter
> that explains how to use all those JUnit-related rules:
>
> http://pmdapplied.com/chapter_11.html

Thanks for that Tom. I think that those links and explaination would
be really beneficial for the anti-patterns. I'll add them in RSN.

Cheers,
Joe

P.S. I enjoyed your JavaPosse interview a while back. Keep up the good
work!
